alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 7:41AM EST until December 20 at 6:18AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Sandy River At Mercer affecting Somerset and Franklin Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Sandy River at Mercer. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, extensive flooding in Farmington, particularly along Main Street south of the University. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 5.7 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.3 feet on 03/15/1977. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
